question: What did Habakkuk receive (Hab 1:1)?
What does Habakkuk say was God’s response to his call for help (Hab 1:2)?
What did Habakkuk cry out to God (Hab 1:2)?
What was God’s response when Habakkuk cried out “Violence” (Hab 1:2)?
What did Habakkuk complain that God made him look at (Hab 1:3)?
What did Habakkuk complain that God had tolerated (Hab 1:3)?
Habakkuk complained all of the following were before him or abounded EXCEPT (Hab 1:3)
What does Habakkuk complain is paralyzed (Hab 1:4)?
What does Habakkuk complain never prevails (Hab 1:4)?
What do the wicked do to the righteous (Hab 1:4)?
What does Habakkuk complain has happened to justice (Hab 1:4)?
choice: It is nowhere to be found

question: What did God tell Habakkuk to look at and be amazed (Hab 1:5)?
What did God say he would do (Hab 1:5)?
Who did God say he was going to raise up (Hab 1:6)?
What do the Babylonians seize (Hab 1:6)?
God characterizes the Babylonians he is raising up in all of the following ways EXCEPT (Hab 1:6)
What are the Babylonian’s horses are faster than (Hab 1:7)?
What are the Babylonians fiercer than (Hab 1:8)?
To what is the Babylonian cavalry likened (Hab 1:8)?
choice: Locusts devouring everything in their path
Flying like a vulture swooping to devour
Running like a lion catching a deer

question: How do their hordes advance (Hab 1:9)?
choice: Like locusts blown in from the desert
Like a storm off the ocean

question: Whom do the Babylonians deride (Hab 1:10)?
How do the Babylonians capture cities (Hab 1:10)?
choice: They shoot fiery arrows into the city

question: How do the Babylonians gather prisoners (Hab 1:9)?
choice: Like the stars of the heavens

question: What is the god of the Babylonians (Hab 1:11)?
Habakkuk calls “My God” his ___________ (Hab 1:12)
Habakkuk calls “My God”  ___________ (Hab 1:12)
What does Habakkuk say God’s relationship with evil cannot be (Hab 1:13)?
choice: His hands will surely not allow it
His ears cannot hear of it
His heart is too righteous to tolerate it
His eyes are too pure to look upon it

question: Habakkuk saying God cannot tolerate wrong asks him how he can tolerate _____ (Hab 1:13)
What happens when God is silent (Hab 1:13)?
choice: The strong take advantage of the weak
The wicked swallow up the more righteous than themselves

question: Like what does Habakkuk say God has made humans (Hab 1:14)?
choice: Like fish in the sea that have no ruler
Like ants which work for so little
Like vultures devouring anything that is dying

question: Who have no ruler over them (Hab 1:14)?
The wicked catches others up with all of the following methods EXCEPT (Hab 1:15)
To what do the wicked burn incense (Hab 1:16)?
By what does the wicked’s net provide (Hab 1:16)?
Habakkuk asks God if the wicked are to keep on emptying there nets resulting in what (Hab 1:17)?
choice: No fish left in the sea
Plunder piled over top of their walls

question: Where does Habakkuk say he will station himself to see how God will answer him (Hab 2:1)?
What was Habakkuk asked to do with God’s revelation (Hab 2:2)?
choice: Rehearse it in the ears of the people

question: Why did Habakkuk stand at his watch (Hab 2:1)?
choice: To see what God would say to him
To guard his people as a watchman

question: Why was Habakkuk to write the revelation on tablets (Hab 2:2)?
choice: So that all could read it
So that a herald may run with it
So that those at the temple may read it
So that it may be placed in the ark of the covenant

question: What does the revelation wait for (Hab 2:3)?
While the revelation may linger what is Habakkuk to do (Hab 2:3)?
choice: Preach it in the city gate

question: How will the righteous live (Hab 2:4)?
choice: By the word of the Lord

question: What betrays him (Babylonians) (Hab 2:5)?
How is his [Babylon’s] greed described (Hab 2:5)?
What does he [Babylon] do to all people (Hab 2:5)?
What does he [Babylon] gather to himself (Hab 2:5)?
How does he [Babylon] make himself wealthy (Hab 2:6)?
How will people react to him [Babylon] (Hab 2:6)?
choice: They will weep for his fall
They will flee into caves from him
They will taunt him with ridicule

question: Who will make Babylon the victim (Hab 2:7)?
Babylon is accused of doing all of the following EXCEPT (Hab 2:8)
Woe is pronounced on the one who builds his realm with ______ (Hab 2:9)
What will they do to escape the clutches of ruin (Hab 2:9)?
How have the Babylonians forfeited their life (Hab 2:10)?
choice: Plotting the ruin of many peoples

question: What will cry out against the Babylonians (Hab 2:11)?
What will echo the stones of the wall crying out (Hab 2:11)?
Who receives a “woe” (Hab 2:12)?
choice: One who builds a city with bloodshed
One who exiles their neighbors who trusted them
One who makes an empire of slaves
One who builds temples to idols

question: Who receives a “woe” (Hab 2:12)?
choice: One who exiles their neighbors who trusted them
One who establishes a town by injustice
One who makes an empire of slaves
One who builds temples to idols

question: For what do the nations exhaust themselves (Hab 2:13)?
With what will the earth be filled (Hab 2:14)?
choice: Violence and oppression at the hands of cruel masters
The goodness of the Lord in the land of the living
The knowledge of the glory of the Lord

question: Like what will the knowledge of the glory of the Lord fill the earth (Hab 2:14)?
choice: As the waters cover the sea
As the sand on the seashore
As the stars of the heaven
As the sun lights up the sky

question: Who receives a “woe” (Nah 2:15)?
choice: One saying what is wrong is right and what is right is wrong
One pouring from the wineskin until they are drunk
Those to swing their swords against those who trusted them
One prophesying of peace when there is no peace

question: Why does one keep pouring from a wineskin until their companion is drunk (Hab 2:15)?
choice: So they will not oppose them
So they can lead them away into exile
So they can gaze on their naked bodies
So they can oppress the needy

question: With what will the Babylonians be filled (Hab 2:16)?
Habakkuk says what turn is it for the Babylonians now (Hab 2:16)?
choice: To drink and let their nakedness be exposed
To have their walls destroyed and left as ruins
To have their temples destroyed with fire

question: What is coming around to the Babylonians (Hab 2:16)?
choice: The cup from the Lord’s right hand
The robe of the Lord’s wrath
What they had done to others

question: What will overwhelm the Babylonians (Hab 2:17)?
choice: The violence they had done to Lebanon
A fire will consume the walls of Babylon

question: What will terrify the Babylonians (Hab 2:17)?
choice: A shadow of darkness that will come over the land
The sun will be turned to blood

question: What teaches lies (Hab 2:18)?
What does God point to that the Babylonian idols cannot do (Hab 2:18)?
To whom is there a woe (Hab 2:19)?
choice: Who says to wood “Come to life”
To the one crafting idols of gold

question: What does an idol not have (Hab 2:19)?
Where is the Lord while the whole earth is to be silent before him (Hab 2:20)?
When God is in his holy temple what should the response of the world be (Hab 2:20)?
choice: Bowing to the ground before him

question: On what does Habakkuk offer his prayer (Hab 3:1)?
In Habakkuk’s prayer he says what has he heard of (Hab 3:2)?
What does Habakkuk pray God would remember in wrath (Hab 3:2)?
What does Habakkuk ask God to renew in his day (Hab 3:2)?
Where does Habakkuk say God came from (Hab 3:3)?
What does God’s praise fill (Hab 3:3)?
From what mount does the Holy One come from (Hab 3:3)?
What does Habakkuk say God’s splendor is like (Hab 3:4)?
choice: A thunder storm in the desert
A gentle rain in the summer

question: Where do rays flash from (Hab 3:4)?
What went before God (Hab 3:5)?
What did pestilence do (Hab 3:5)?
What happened when God stood (Hab 3:6)?
When God stood what happened to the ancient mountains (Hab 3:6)?
How does Habakkuk describe God’s ways (Hab 3:6)?
Whose tents did Habakkuk see in distress (Hab 3:6)?
Whose dwellings did Habakkuk see in anguish (Hab 3:7)?
What does Habakkuk portray God riding on (Hab 3:7)?
choice: On horses and his victorious chariots
On the clouds of the heavens
On the wings of the dawn
On eagles wings swooping down to devour

question: What did Habakkuk ask God if he raged against (Hab 3:8)?
What happened when the Lord looks (Hab 3:6)?
choice: He sees the hearts of all the people
The desert caves are lit up

question: What did God uncover (Hab 3:9)?
With what did God split the earth (Hab 3:9)?
What writhed when they saw the Lord (Hab 3:10)?
In Habakkuk’s prayer what roared (Hab 3:10)?
Habakkuk describes what happening to the sun and moon (Hab 3:11)?
choice: Becoming blood red in the sky

question: Habakkuk describes lightning flashing from _____ (Hab 3:11)
What did God do in anger (Hab 3:12)?
choice: Cut their enemies with a sickle
Sent an army of locusts against them

question: Who did God come out to save (Hab 3:13)?
Who did God crush (Hab 3:13)?
choice: The leader of the land of wickedness
The priests of the foreign gods

question: What did God do to the leader of the land of wickedness (Hab 3:13)?
choice: Sent him into exile at the head of his people
Stripped him from head to foot

question: Who were his [Chaldean] warriors gloating as though about to devour (Hab 3:14)?
choice: Their enemies upon the city walls
The wretched who were in hiding

question: With what did God trample the sea (Hab 3:15)?
When Habakkuk heard the churning of the great waters he had all of the following responses EXCEPT (Hab 3:16)
For what will Habakkuk wait patiently (Hab 3:16)?
choice: The day of calamity coming on the nation invading Israel
The Day of the Lord coming with the clouds of heaven
The great day coming on all the unrighteous
The time of the end when injustice will be swept away forever

question: What will Habakkuk do though the fig tree does not bud (Hab 3:17f)?
choice: Praise God from whom all blessings flow

question: Habakkuk will rejoice even though all of the following happen EXCEPT (Hab 3:17)?
choice: The fig tree does not bud
There are no grapes on the vines
There is not wheat in the field
There are no sheep in the pen

question: Habakkuk says the Lord is ________ (Hab 3:19)
What does God do for Habakkuk (Hab 3:19)?
choice: Makes his heart like a lion
Makes his feet like the feet of a deer
Makes him as strong as a bear

question: Where does God allow Habakkuk to go (Hab 3:19)?
choice: Through the valley of the shadow of death

question: The prayer of Habakkuk was to be played on _______ (Hab 3:19)
Who is given directions at the end of Habakkuk’s prayer (Hab 3:19)?
